comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment > I’ve been using AdGuard for a long time, and it has always worked perfectly. However, over the past few months, it started showing me ads on SoundCloud and some other apps as well. I reported the issue to the AdGuard team, but I received one of the worst customer support responses ever. Their reply was: “Somehow, it has decided to show you the ads,” which made me seriously question whether they even care. > > Anyway, I did my best and tried everything I could find online, but I wasn’t able to fix the issue myself. As I mentioned, the AdGuard support team was no help at all. > > Right now, AdGuard has completely stopped working. I’m seeing ads everywhere — on YouTube, Google Chrome, various apps, and even on some social networks where I never saw ads before. I’ve attached a screenshot from YouTube, but that’s just one example — the problem is widespread. > > I have no idea what’s going on — whether AdGuard is gradually failing or there’s an issue on my end. Please have someone experienced and knowledgeable look into this, not like the previous support rep who seemed more interested in brushing me off than actually resolving the problem. I’ve also attached a link to my previous report for reference. > > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/197236#issuecomment-2695212996 Username: `@sakciit` ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/support.s3.yandex.net/ugcsup_image_ede531cddf2.png__;!!AVV8_I5aC8o!ucYHCAJMNozCBkygHnXmtCtqYJ4BDhxPuC_h7VmYXQV2qnmlA_0RDsml9wA9LgKh1_bm6lGsoRprxn1JksEiOWoiVvyPcuYf$](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Furldefense.com%2Fv3%2F__https%3A%2Fsupport.s3.yandex.net%2Fugcsup_image_ede531cddf2.png__%3B!!AVV8_I5aC8o!ucYHCAJMNozCBkygHnXmtCtqYJ4BDhxPuC_h7VmYXQV2qnmlA_0RDsml9wA9LgKh1_bm6lGsoRprxn1JksEiOWoiVvyPcuYf%24) ### Comment > Столкнулся с проблемой, что ссылки со знаком $ на конце не открываются корректно. Путём экспериментов с помощью службы поддержки Яндекс Браузер удалось выявить, что проблема возникает только при включённом расширении AdGuard. > Пример неработающей ссылки - > https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://www.ozon.ru/my/orderdetails/?order=00178595-0888&shipment_id=31236476563&t_usr=178595&userid=178595&utm_mcp_vid=cw8pd538v1h2qt5h6wz0&utm_mid=7011660082048941528&utm_content=block-button&utm_mcp_el_name=button&utm_mcp_pos=1&utm_mcp_block_id=cxmjkv4bznp01jywdnd0__;!!AVV8_I5aC8o!s7v4slBs1JeUv7cUUAcT6BCoEBAH3kBnlXjqpkfB6BwauUwmqnmjCS9DT_p-eU--X3Bkd7hm_tPQgdryz9YwVzN9pic$ > Если убрать префикс https://urldefense.com/v3/__ то всё работает корректно. > В других браузерах и при отключенном расширении тоже всё работает. > Подозреваю, что расширение при проверке ссылки обрезает знак $ > ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973
